OpenAPIDocument.description: Root of an OpenAPI specification file

MediaType.description: Media type and schema for request/response body

Contains relationship

Tag.description: A metadata label used to group and categorize API operations for documentation organization. Enables logical grouping of endpoints in generated API documentation.

ExternalDocumentation.description: A reference to external documentation resources (URLs, wikis, guides) that provide additional context beyond the inline API specification. Links API elements to comprehensive documentation.

Contact.description: Contact information for the API owner or maintainer, including name, email, and URL. Enables consumers to reach out for support or collaboration.

License.description: Specifies the legal license under which the API is provided, including license name and URL to full terms. Clarifies usage rights for API consumers.

ServerVariable.description: A variable placeholder in server URL templates that can be substituted at runtime. Enables dynamic server addressing for different environments or tenants.

Header.description: Defines HTTP header parameters for requests or responses, specifying name, schema, required status, and description. Documents header-based communication requirements.

Link.description: Describes a relationship between API responses and subsequent operations, enabling hypermedia-driven API navigation. Supports HATEOAS design patterns.

Callback.description: Defines a webhook or callback URL pattern where the API will send asynchronous notifications. Enables event-driven integrations and async workflows.

Example.description: Provides sample values for request bodies, responses, or parameters. Improves documentation clarity and enables automated testing or mocking.

Encoding.description: Specifies serialization details for multipart request body properties, including content-type, headers, and encoding style. Handles complex content negotiation.

OAuthFlows.description: Configuration for OAuth 2.0 authentication flows (implicit, password, clientCredentials, authorizationCode), specifying authorization URLs, token URLs, and scopes. Defines OAuth security implementation.
